Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: IKM SQL to Hyperion Planning
AUTHOR: Oracle
Description : - Integration Knowledge Module For Hyperion Planning. This knowledge module allows to load metadata, data and UDA's into Hyperion Planning applications. - Please refer to the user guide for setup instructions.
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - LOAD_ORDER_BY_INPUT: Load the records in the order received. - SORT_PARENT_CHILD: Sort the records in parent-child order. - LOG_ENABLED: Enable logging. - LOG_FILE_NAME: Specify log file name. - MAXIMUM_ERRORS_ALLOWED: Maximum number of errors before loading stops. - LOG_ERRORS: Enable logging of error records. - ERROR_LOG_FILENAME: Specify error file name. - ERR_COL_DELIMITER: The column delimiter to be used for the error record file. - ERR_ROW_DELIMITER: The row delimiter to be used for the error record file. - ERR_TEXT_DELIMITER: The text delimiter to be used for the column data in the error records file. - ERR_LOG_HEADER_ROW: Write a header row containing the column names to the error record file. - REFRESH_DATABASE: Perform a cube refresh after the load is completed.

If this option is set to "Yes", then the records will be loaded to the planning application in the order they are received.
If this option is set to "No", then the records are sorted in Ascending order (Alpha-Numeric sorting) before loading into the planning application.

If the incoming records are not in the correct order, i.e, parent records first and then child records, some of the records will not be loaded into the target.
Setting this option to "Yes" will sort the records in parent-child order so that all parents are inserted first before the children.
Please note that setting this option to "Yes" has an impact on the loading performance.
If the incoming records are already in the correct parent-child order, then you should set this option to "No".
Flag to indicate if logging should be performed during the load process. If set to Yes, logging would be done to the file specified by the LOG_FILE_NAME option.
The fully qualified name of the file into which logging is to be done.
The maximum number of allowed error

By default, this value is zero, which means that it will ignore any errors that occurs during the insert process into the target. If this is set to a value greater than zero, then, the load process will stop with an error once it reaches the specified number of errors.
If this option is set to "Yes", error records are logged to a file specified by the ERROR_LOG_FILE name option.
Specify the name of the file into which the error records should be logged.
The column delimiter for error file
The column delimiter to be used for the error records file.
The row delimiter for error file
The row delimiter to be used for the error records file.
The text delimiter for error file
The text delimiter to be used for the column data in the error records file. To use double quote ('"') as text delimiter, specify '\"'.
Flag to log the header row
If this option is set to Yes, then the header row containing the column names is logged to the error records file.
If this option is set to "Yes", then a cube refresh is performance after the load is completed.

<% if ("C".equals(snpRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> update <%=snpRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> set JRN_CONSUMED = '1' where (1=1) <%=snpRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>

from java.util import HashMap from java.lang import Boolean from java.lang import Integer from com.hyperion.odi.common import ODIConstants from com.hyperion.odi.connection import HypAppConnectionFactory
# # Target planning connection properties # serverName = "<%=snpRef.getInfo("DEST_DSERV_NAME")%>" userName = "<%=snpRef.getInfo("DEST_USER_NAME")%>" password = "<%=snpRef.getInfo("DEST_PASS")%>" application = "<%=snpRef.getInfo("DEST_CATALOG")%>"
srvportParts = serverName.split(':',2) srvStr = srvportParts[0] portStr = srvportParts[1]
# # Put the connection properites and initialize the planning loader # targetProps = HashMap() targetProps.put(ODIConstants.SERVER,srvStr) targetProps.put(ODIConstants.PORT,portStr) targetProps.put(ODIConstants.USER,userName) targetProps.put(ODIConstants.PASSWORD,password) targetProps.put(ODIConstants.APPLICATION_NAME,application)
print "Initalizing the planning wrapper and connecting" pWriter = HypAppConnectionFactory.getAppWriter(HypAppConnectionFactory.APP_PLANNING, targetProps);
dimension = "<%=snpRef.getTargetTable("RES_NAME")%>" loadOrder = <%=snpRef.getOption("LOAD_ORDER_BY_INPUT")%> sortParentChild = <%=snpRef.getOption("SORT_PARENT_CHILD")%> logEnabled = <%=snpRef.getOption("LOG_ENABLED")%> logFileName = r"<%=snpRef.getOption("LOG_FILE_NAME")%>" maxErrors = <%=snpRef.getOption("MAXIMUM_ERRORS_ALLOWED")%> logErrors = <%=snpRef.getOption("LOG_ERRORS")%> cubeRefresh = <%=snpRef.getOption("REFRESH_DATABASE")%> errFileName = r"<%=snpRef.getOption("ERROR_LOG_FILENAME")%>" errColDelimiter = r"<%=snpRef.getOption("ERR_COL_DELIMITER")%>" errRowDelimiter = r"<%=snpRef.getOption("ERR_ROW_DELIMITER")%>" #errTextDelimiter = r"<%=snpRef.getOption("ERR_TEXT_DELIMITER")%>" errTextDelimiter = r"<%=snpRef.getOption("ERR_TEXT_DELIMITER")%>" logHeader = <%=snpRef.getOption("ERR_LOG_HEADER_ROW")%>
# set the load options loadOptions = HashMap() loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.SORT_IN_PARENT_CHILD, Boolean(sortParentChild)) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.LOAD_ORDER_BY_INPUT, Boolean(loadOrder)) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.DIMENSION, dimension) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.LOG_ENABLED, Boolean(logEnabled)) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.LOG_FILE_NAME, logFileName) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.MAXIMUM_ERRORS_ALLOWED, Integer(maxErrors)) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.LOG_ERRORS, Boolean(logErrors)) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.ERROR_LOG_FILENAME, errFileName) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.ERR_COL_DELIMITER, errColDelimiter) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.ERR_ROW_DELIMITER, errRowDelimiter) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.ERR_TEXT_DELIMITER, errTextDelimiter) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.ERR_LOG_HEADER_ROW, Boolean(logHeader)) loadOptions.put(ODIConstants.REFRESH_DATABASE, Boolean(cubeRefresh))
#call begin load pWriter.beginLoad(loadOptions)

from com.hyperion.odi.common import ODIConstants from com.hyperion.odi.connection import HypAppConnectionFactory from java.lang import Class from java.lang import Boolean from java.sql import * from java.util import HashMap # # Get the select statement on the staging area: # sql= """select <%=odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS") %> <%=odiRef.getColList("", "[EXPRESSION]", ",", "", "INS and !TRG") %> from <%=odiRef.getFrom() %> where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getFilter() %> <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter() %> <%=odiRef.getJoin() %> <%=odiRef.getGrpBy() %> <%=odiRef.getHaving() %>"""
tarray = []
<%=odiRef.getColList("", "tarray.append(\u0022[COL_NAME]\u0022)", "\n", "", "INS and !TRG") %>
srcCx = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("SRC")
stmt = srcCx.createStatement()
srcFetchSize=<?if("".equals(odiRef.getInfo("SRC_FETCH_ARRAY"))){out.print("1000");}else{out.print(odiRef.getInfo("SRC_FETCH_ARRAY"));}?>
stmt.setFetchSize(srcFetchSize)
rs = stmt.executeQuery(sql)
#load the data stats = pWriter.loadData(rs, tarray)
#close the database result set, connection rs.close() stmt.close()
statString = stats.toString() raise "Planning Writer Load Summary", statString

<% if ("C".equals(snpRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> delete from <%=snpRef.getTable("L","JRN_NAME","A")%> where JRN_CONSUMED = '1' <%=snpRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>
